column2: RHODE ISLAND PERMIT TEST
column4: Rhode Island
column6: RI

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. When driving on the freeway behind large trucks, you should:
column4: increase your following distance.
column6: move to the right of the truck and pass it quickly.
column8: drive closer behind the truck than for a passenger vehicle.

column2: 2. Look over your shoulder to check your blind spot:
column4: on all right and left turns.
column6: when pulling to the right side of the road or away from a curb.

column2: 3. This sign means:
column4: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column6: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column8: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 4. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: turn on the radio to keep you awake.
column6: have a beer or two to keep you awake.
column10: find a safe place to stop for a break.

column2: 5. When driving in fog, you should never use your high beams because:
column4: the light will reflect back into your eyes.
column6: vehicles behind you may follow too closely.
column8: oncoming vehicles might not see you.

column2: 6. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column6: traffic from all four directions must stop.
column8: there are four stop signs at this intersection.

column2: 7. Which statement about drinking alcohol and driving is true?
column4: Alcohol affects judgement and coordination, which are needed to drive safely.
column6: After drinking, a cold shower will sober you up.
column8: If you are under the legal BAC limit, your driving is not affected.

column2: 8. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.
column6: you increase the chance of a crash.

column2: 9. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.
column6: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column8: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column10: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.

column2: 10. The octagonal shape is used:
column4: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.
column6: exclusively for stop signs.
column10: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.

column2: 11. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column6: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.
column8: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.

column2: 12. When passing you should NOT:
column4: signal left to let others know that you will be pulling out.
column6: look in your rearview mirrors and glance over your shoulder before pulling out to pass.
column8: leave less than 4 feet of space between your vehicle and the vehicle you are passing.
column10: go far enough past the vehicle you are passing so that you can see the vehicle in your inside rearview mirror.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: Drive with caution and be ready to stop
column6: Do not block intersection
column10: You must come to a complete stop

column2: 14. When you see this sign, you should:
column4: stop at the crosswalk until a crossing guard signals you to go.
column6: be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.
column10: slow down, proceed with caution and watch for blind people.

column2: 15. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column4: of a steering failure.
column6: that a tire blowout is about to occur.

column2: 16. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.
column6: Apply the parking brake slowly.
column8: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.

column2: 17. Hydroplaning is usually caused by:
column4: excessive speed.
column6: sudden turns.

column2: 18. Your BAC depends on:
column4: the type of beverage you drink.
column6: the amount of alcohol you drink.

column2: 19. Braking distance is affected by:
column4: the speed your vehicle is traveling.
column6: pavement conditions.
column8: the condition of your brakes and tires.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column4: A four-way intersection is ahead
column6: You must turn left ahead

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column4: Slow down or stop
column6: Road narrows ahead

column2: 22. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column4: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.
column6: You should look over your shoulder instead.

column2: 23. Blocking an intersection during rush hour traffic is not permitted:
column4: unless you have the right-of-way.
column6: unless you entered the intersection on a green light.

column2: 24. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column4: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.
column6: you must do it.
column10: you must wait for the red light to turn green.

column2: 25. Which shape is a warning sign?
column4: Round
column6: Diamond
